definition: enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery

sentences.english: Unfortunately the treaty is full of generalities, and fails to get down to specifics.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是條約很籠統，訂得不具體。

sentences.english: In 2010, generalized concerns and exhortations will not suffice.
sentences.chinese: 在2010年，籠統的關注和規勸是不夠的。

sentences.english: You can only analize your database if there is data which you can change.
sentences.chinese: 你只能籠統地數據庫是否有數據，您可以更改。

sentences.english: I had two questions, one more general.
sentences.chinese: 我有兩個問題，一個略爲籠統些。

sentences.english: Unfortunately the treaty are full of generality, and fail to get down to specific.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是條約很籠統，訂得不具體。

sentences.english: It's a specific question . Don't answer it at large .
sentences.chinese: 這是個具體問題，不要籠統回答。

sentences.english: The report described these accounting irregularities only in general terms.
sentences.chinese: 報告只是籠統地談了這些會計違規行爲。

sentences.english: It’s a foggy generalization of a time that will likely never come.
sentences.chinese: 它是一種籠統的時間概念，而且可能永遠都不會出現。

sentences.english: What you end up promoting is a very general message to be active.
sentences.chinese: 活躍起來做點什麼可以是個很籠統的信息。

sentences.english: The superior's measurments are often equally vague.
sentences.chinese: 上級的衡量往往是平均而籠統的。
避免含糊的和籠統的支出。

sentences.english: So you might say,in some loose sense they've gotten your haircut.
sentences.chinese: 所以你也可以籠統地說他代替你剪了頭髮。

sentences.english: Lumping students into this amorphous Chinese applicant pool really isn't doing them justice.
sentences.chinese: 籠統地把所有中國申請人扔在一塊確實對他們不公平。

sentences.english: It's just a general essay about anything you want to write about.
sentences.chinese: 文章的內容很籠統，你想寫些什麼就可以寫些什麼。

sentences.english: In GATS, the article related to environmental protection is too vague.
sentences.chinese: GATS中關於環境保護的條款過於籠統。

sentences.english: You can put Money as a one-word description, but it is too general.
sentences.chinese: 你能用”錢“作爲單獨單詞表述，可是過於籠統。

definition: to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
to differentiate/to draw a distinction/to divide into categories
to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
